result.execSummary:
The defendant Jayson J. Crow Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs are due as follows:  $25.00 is due on or before 05/05/2022 and then the 5th of every month thereafter until paid in full.  $15.00 payment plan fee added.  Failure to pay any part of the court costs will result in 1 day in jail for every $25 left unpaid.

The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen and report for booking. Contact the Jackson County Sheriff's Department at 715-284-5357 to arrange for an appointment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jayson J. Crow Sr.

defendant.name: Crow, Jayson J., Sr.
defendant.address: W8264 US Hwy 12 #4, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.addlTxt:
10:28 AM Defendant Jayson J. Crow Sr. in court.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bryant S Plank in court for Jayson J. Crow Sr. Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to Count 1. 

Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. He understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea. Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Disorderly Conduct contrary to 947.01(1), 968.075(1)(a) domestic abuse enhancer. Court amends the complaint to strike the repeater allegation. Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution. 

Joint recommendation: Court costs only. 

Court adopts joint recommendation: Orders court costs $543.00. Pay at $25.00 month, starting 5/5 and the 5th day of each month thereafter until paid in full.    

The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen and report for booking. Contact the Jackson County Sheriff's Department at 715-284-5357 to arrange for an appointment.
